titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 650: Franciscans of Metz

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Ms. Codex 650: Franciscans of Metz are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

notesStmt.note: The second section (f. 16r) begins with the same introduction as the first.
Notarial statement, with seal, of Natalis Wassonius de Pontemontione (f. 59r-v).
Evidence of worm damage in boards.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Collection of papal letters and instruments respecting privileges of the Friars Minor of Metz, France, compiled by Petrus de Vincentia. In two parts: f. 1r-15v and f. 16r-58v. Comprised of letters and bulls of Popes Innocent VII, Pius II, Paul II[?], Sixtus IV, Eugene IV[?], and Innocent VIII.

supportDesc.extent: 60 leaves : 128 x 80 (87 x 57) mm. bound to 130 x 85 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Parchment, i (contemporary parchment) + 60 + i (contemporary parchment); 1-60, contemporary foliation in ink, upper right recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 23-24 long lines; ruled in ink; prickings visible.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a Gothic cursive script by a single hand, with notarial statement and owner note in two different hands (f. 59r-59v).

decoDesc.decoNote: 12-line penwork initial in brown ink (f. 1r); 10-line penwork initial in brown ink (f. 16r).

binding.p: Contemporary blind-stamped leather over wooden boards. Inside upper cover has a 4.5 cm. diameter circular hole. One clasp intact.

origin.p: Written in Metz[?] between 1489 and 1490 (Zacour-Hirsch). Date of 1490 given on f. 15r.

history.provenance: Ownership inscription: Iste liber est de conventu fratrum minorum Sagunsium (f. 59v).

keywords.term: Monasticism and religious orders--Early works to 1800
